meanings.definition: Strengthened or protected with defensive works
meanings.sent1: The castle was fortified with high walls and a sturdy gate.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers built a fortified bunker to shield themselves from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's treehouse was so fortified, even the wind couldn't knock it down.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was like a fortified wall, unyielding to any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The knight's armor was so well fortified, it seemed impenetrable to any sword strike.

meanings.sent1: The friendship between the two children was fortified by their shared adventures.
meanings.sent2: The new lock on the door fortified the house against potential burglars.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape not only looked cool but also fortified his image as a protector.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a fortified shield, deflecting any negative comments.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the siblings was so fortified, nothing could break it.

meanings.definition: Provided with added nutrients, usually vitamins or minerals
meanings.sent1: The fortified cereal was a great way to start the day with extra vitamins.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a fortified drink to help boost the patient's immune system.
meanings.sent3: The fortified milk tasted just like regular milk but had extra nutrients.
meanings.sent4: Her diet included fortified foods to ensure she got all the necessary vitamins.
meanings.sent5: The fortified orange juice was a refreshing way to get essential nutrients in the morning.
